aboutSection.title: CONSULLAB
aboutSection.subtitle: About us
aboutSection.description1: Consullab is an Angolan law firm that operates in the field of legal, financial, and tax consulting, providing all assistance in a modality we call institutional consulting to highlight the integrated and multifaceted perspective of its operations.
aboutSection.description2: We meticulously analyze each situation to offer the best legal solutions, focusing on practical and efficient results.

values1.title: Transparency
values1.description: Our projects prioritize well-founded and justifiable solutions, leaving no doubts about their origin and efficiency

values2.title: Democracy
values2.description: Our projects are built jointly with partners/clients, in a perspective of permanent and free dialogue

values3.title: Progress
values3.description: We accompany our partners and measure their growth. The initially determined goals are regularly evaluated, with a strong concern for their effectiveness.

statsSection.title: The consultancy
statsSection.description: We understand that each client is unique, and that's why our approach is always personalized. We meticulously analyze each situation to offer the best legal solutions, focusing on practical and efficient results. Our commitment is to the success and satisfaction of our clients, ensuring that their legal issues are treated with due attention and professionalism.

card.title: ABOUT US
card.description: History and competencies of our consultancy

servicesSection.title: Our services
servicesSection.subtitle: We operate in the most complex areas of law, offering services of various natures.

quoteSection.quote: At Consullab, we believe that transparency is the foundation of every relationship of trust. Our commitment is to be clear, honest, and direct with our clients, so they always know where they are and where we are going together.
quoteSection.description: We believe that the true value of legal consulting lies in the ability to anticipate problems and create strategies that protect and boost our clients' businesses.

teamSection.title: Our team
teamSection.subtitle: Embodying excellence, professionalism, reliability, and creativity, we have a team with a wide range of specializations.
teamSection.description1: At Consullab, we believe that our clients' success begins with the strength and excellence of our team. Composed of highly qualified lawyers, consultants, economists, and managers who are specialists in various areas. Our team is the foundation that supports every service we offer.
teamSection.description2: We value collaboration in our team, believing that the best solutions emerge when brilliant minds work together. Our integrated approach allows us to consider all facets of a legal problem, offering more complete and robust solutions.

diagnostics.title: Conducting Institutional Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: All construction and planning of an institution's activities requires conducting in-depth diagnostics to determine the real situation of the institution in order to create solutions for real problems that are more appropriate as they are based on real surveys of the organization's situation.
diagnostics.areasDescription: The institutional diagnosis covers various areas of work

description.1: Identification of existing regulations and norms in the institution;
description.2: Analysis of the practical application of current norms and regulations;
description.3: Identification of regulatory gaps in the institution.

description.1: Survey of data from the institution's legal processes;
description.2: Identification of the main legal documents that are processed in the institution;
description.3: Identification of the legal regime applicable to the institution.

description.1: Identification of the employees' training framework;
Survey of the main documents processed in the institution;
description.2: Identification of the organization method for the institution's archives.

team.description: We look beyond today's issues. We also like to look at tomorrow's opportunities and challenges. To the future and to your point on the horizon. We do this with a team of enthusiastic experts who possess all the necessary legal knowledge on the path to a sustainable and successful future.

privateSection.title: Private
privateSection.description: Whether it's the end of your relationship or a dispute over the resolution of a will, legal issues of personal and family law and inheritance law can have a profound impact on your personal life. Moreover, they are often accompanied by many emotions. Our experienced specialists know this better than anyone. We are happy to help you so that you can look to the future with confidence.

benefits.subtitle: Feel good about coming to work with us.
benefits.description: We offer an exceptional work environment with great growth opportunities

paragraphs.title: What will you work on?
paragraphs.paragraphs: One of the most significant changes in the new labor laws is the flexibility of work hours. The legislation now allows employers and employees to negotiate more adaptable schedules to suit both parties' needs. <paragraph>This includes the possibility of reduced work hours, compressed workweeks, and the adoption of flexible hours, as long as the legal limits are respected. According to experts, this flexibility can benefit both companies and workers by promoting a more balanced and productive work environment. However, it's essential that these negotiations are formalized through collective or individual agreements to avoid future conflicts and ensure that workers' rights are preserved.</paragraph>

DetailsTeam.title: Alexandre Francisco
DetailsTeam.description1: Alexandre Francisco is a legal consultant at Consullab, with over 15 years of experience in the legal sector. Specializing in Business and Contract Law, Alexandre stands out for his ability to develop strategic legal solutions for companies from various sectors. Throughout his career, he has worked at renowned law firms and advised large corporations on issues related to corporate governance, compliance, mergers, and acquisitions.
DetailsTeam.description2: Alexandre holds a Law degree from XYZ University and a postgraduate degree in Business Law from ABC College. Additionally, he has participated in extension courses on international law and arbitration. Known for his professionalism and ethics, he is often invited to speak at events on topics related to innovation in Business Law.
DetailsTeam.description3: With his commitment to helping companies navigate legal complexities safely, Alexandre significantly contributes to the success of Consullab's clients.

blog.newLaborRules: New Labor Rules Come Into Effect and Impact Labor Relations

DetailsBlog.title: New Labor Rules Come into Effect and Impact Labor Relations
DetailsBlog.article_intro: The Brazilian labor landscape has undergone significant changes with the implementation of a new set of rules that promises to transform labor relations in the country.
paragraphs: One of the most notable changes in the new labor rules is the flexibility of working hours. Legislation now allows employers and employees to negotiate work hours that better fit their needs. This includes the possibility of reduced work hours, compressed work weeks, and the adoption of flexible schedules, as long as the limits established by law are respected.

According to experts, this flexibility can benefit both companies and workers, promoting a more balanced and productive work environment. However, it is essential that these negotiations are formalized through collective or individual agreements to avoid future conflicts and ensure that workers' rights are preserved.

The new guidelines also brought changes to workers' vacation rights. Now, vacations can be divided into up to three periods, one of which must be at least 14 consecutive days. Additionally, employees have the option to 'sell' up to 1/3 of their vacation time, a practice that was already common but is now more clearly regulated.

This change aims to provide greater flexibility for workers, allowing them to enjoy rest periods at different times of the year. For companies, this change may facilitate the management of absences and the maintenance of productivity.

With the rise of remote work, especially after the pandemic, the new labor rules include clearer regulations for telecommuting. Companies now need to formalize the telecommuting arrangement in writing, establishing working conditions, responsibilities of each party, and the way to control working hours.

Moreover, the rules also provide that costs related to telecommuting, such as internet, electricity, and equipment, must be negotiated between employer and employee. The regulation seeks to provide legal security for both parties and avoid disputes that may arise from this new work model.

Changes in labor rules require immediate adaptation by companies, which need to review their contracts, internal policies, and management practices to comply with the new requirements. Experts warn that failure to comply with the new rules can result in severe penalties, including fines and labor lawsuits.

On the other hand, employees should also be aware of the new provisions, understanding their rights and the possibilities now available to them. Knowledge and correct application of these new rules are essential to avoid conflicts and ensure a healthy and productive working relationship.
